page.title: 13The Clifton Brook
page.content: The Clifton Brook is a long, fairly wide stretch of water,sometimes deep and at other points very shallow. It runs mainly through wild,waste ground, and has for inhabitants numerous specimens of water wildlife. Men have considerably spoiled the stream, both for the creatures and where general appearance is concerned, by polluting it with oil waste and dumping rubbish (as people do with any such brook). Now car tyres, metal scraps, bricks, tins etc. abound in any part of the stream. At one point in the stream we observed the creation of rapids;a part of the brook which flows much faster and is rougher than the water to its immediate right or left.The deep water meets a shallow area and its own pressure causes it to flow very quickly over and around the stones.
